Class Gun

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.targetpractice.Gun

  • public class Gun
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Miguel Menjivar Gun object never have a method that is more 15 - 20 lines of code TODO: ammo count works and shoot method works and decreases weapon capacity by one, just need to fix if target was accurate or not

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Gun()
      Default constructor that will initialize handgun with only 7 rounds and 85% accuracy
      Gun(int accuracy, int ammo)
      Will overload constructor to set values for the rifle or shotgun

    • Constructor Detail

      • Gun

        public Gun()
        Default constructor that will initialize handgun with only 7 rounds and 85% accuracy

      • Gun

        public Gun(int accuracy,
           int ammo)
        Will overload constructor to set values for the rifle or shotgun
        Parameters:
        accuracy - will hold the value associated with the rifle or shotgun methods
        ammo - will hold the ammunition provided by each weapon which will be different for each weapon

    • Method Detail

      • shoot

        public boolean shoot(int rand)
        This method will return a boolean value whether the weapon shot or not
        Returns:
        the return value shows whether the weapon has successfully hit the target or not

      • reload

        public void reload()
        This will be a default method for reload that will reload the clip to the max capacity of the weapon

      • reload

        public void reload(int ammo)
        overloaded method for reload that will request from user how much ammo they will want

      • setAmmo

        public void setAmmo(int ammo)
        Setter for ammunition field method
        Parameters:
        ammo - will set parameter equal to private field ammo

      • setAccuracy

        public void setAccuracy(int accuracy)
        Setter for accuracy
        Parameters:
        accuracy - will set the parameter equal to the private field accuracy

      • getAmmo

        public int getAmmo()
        Getter for ammunition
        Returns:
        will return the value inside the ammo field

      • getAccuracy

        public int getAccuracy()
        Getter for accuracy
        Returns:
        will return the value that is associated with the private field accuracy
